title: Relative Clauses which or what
instructions: Complete the sentences with the relative pronouns, which, that, nothing (---) or what.

remarks: correct: what
correct: what
C

sentence: we crashed with our car was cut down two days after our accident.
remarks: C
corr: which. After a preposition don't use that. Only which is good.
corr: which. The pronoun 'what' cannot refer back to a noun. Here, to the noun 'tree'.

sentence: We haven't even started the jobs
should have been finished by now.
remarks: C
corr: that. 'what' should come after a verb, it can't refer back to a noun, here: the jobs.
corr: that. 'who' refers to a person, not inanimate objects.

sentence: were on TV last night said that the economy will improve.
remarks: corr: who. 'what' cannot refer to persons like 'experts'.
C
corr: who. 'which' cannot refer to person like 'experts'.

sentence: sold best last year seems to be great success this year, too.
remarks: corr: that. We cannot omit the rel. pronoun because not it's the subject of the relative clause.
C
corr: that. 'what' cannot refer to nouns, it follows a verb.
corr: that. 'what' can't refer back to a noun. It follows only verbs.
corr: that. If there's 'all' in the sentence, 'that' is better than 'which'
C

sentence: he’d ever made was to marry her.
remarks: corr: that or you can omit the pronoun.
C
C

sentence: was presented to us was from a foreign company.
remarks: corr: which. A rel. pronoun is necessary because it is the subject of the realtive clause.
corr: which. 'what' follows a verb, it can't refer to a noun.
C
corr: which. We cannot leave out the rel. pronoun because it's the subject of the relative clause.
corr: which. 'what' cannot follow a noun (the car).
C
